instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Have an older MacBook Pro with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
The board measures fine as far as I can tell, but I don't get <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>

On <CHIP>U7870</CHIP> Pin 3, 5 and 6 all measures the correct voltages but Pin 8 is at 0V

I have some difficulties figuring out how the <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> circuit works, ca anyone enlighten me?

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Pin 8 is tied to 3 more  PGOOD outputs. One of them is pulling it low.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: That's what I was thinking, then I'll just have to figure out how and which one :)

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Well, it turned out it was <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> that caused the problem, replaced it now and all good... Thank you for sending me in the right direction Dukefawks
